column4: is there a way I can use apt to force a program to give me its configuration screen again?
uswsusp thinks my swap is "inactive" and not valid. But I barely ever get into swap memory unless I'm doing something rather intensive, so I think this might be causing it?
inactive means not mounted for use I think
in theory it should. Type free and see if you have as much swap space as you think
What unit does free display its memory in?
hmm, seems that I do have as much swap as I know I have. But it also seems that free disagrees about the amount of memory in use when compared to the system monitor.
sorry that wsnt meant for you
I went ahead with installing uswsusp even with the "your swap is inactive" and it seems that bad things happened.
that should mount all available swap
Did that, i'm going to try the -r option to force it to use the correct swap partition, see if that works, although I think I might have booted ubuntu with noacpi, so I don't know if this will work
noacpi shouldnt influence swap in any way
